alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 2:31AM CDT until May 09 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CHERRY COUNTY... At 230 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, or 14 miles south of Valentine, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Wood Lake, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River, Sparks and Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 192 and 223. Highway 97 between mile markers 128 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 191 and 216. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 6, and between mile markers 10 and 21. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
